column4: this will tell you what groups belong to the 1st user you created
and will give you a hint on what group you want for other users
i have another trouble: I updated 8.04->10.04. i did fresh install but just keep /home partition. well i have a canon eos 350D rebel XT digital reflex camera but gphoto (PTP) doesn't work ANYMORE
if i plug the camera i get error and if i unplug it well the camera remains screwed up and ANY COMPUTER can read it using PTP. i have to remove battery..
don't use gphoto, but did you upgrade it?
as i said i did fresh install. i'm sure in 2 years gphoto was updated
but i still have the old config files
for everything. gnome eog, f-spot gphoto : all my config files
and dont know which could be broken by an updated package
OH, I thought you just updated the OS, I missed the fresh install thing
config files should auto-update and new version should cope with old version config files
it was in a separate partition and told to use that during installation
install the medibuntu repositories and see if that gets your canon functionality back
I sort of remember needing a few libraries from medibuntu to get my XTI working in lucid
I am just shooting in the dark though without a pastebin of your logs
theres something weird because the same camera works on fresh install UNR 10.04 !!
ah, yes, then pastebin as verbose of a log as you can get then and we'll track it down
ok i dont have that machine now. i'll be back here then
